Questions: How do you add the user feed?
Answer:
The Omnia User Feed can be added through a web part on any Omnia web page or can be part of the Notification Panel.


To add a User Feed to a Omnia web page, or the start page, do the following:


1. Go to the page.
2. Edit the page in advanced mode.
3. Add the web part to a suitable web part zone. The web part is called "User Feed" and is found in the "Omnia" Category.
4. Check in the page. (You must do that to be able to access the settings.)
5. To access the settings for the control, activate the Edit option and click the settings gear for the control. \n\n To add User Feed to the notification panel “Notification” must be set to “Custom”, for the User Feed.

Questions: How do you use categories?
Document Management Administrator Using Categories
Answer:
If there are many templates you can use Categories to group them. It's most likely more useful for templates that will be used for general, non-controlled documents.


The first step is to create the Cateogories you will use (you can of course add more Categories later) and then add Categories when adding or editing templates. Using Categories is never mandatory, and even if you use them, some templates can still have no Category. On the other hand, a template can belong to more than one Category.


![](https://github.com/preciofishbone/OmniaDocs/raw/master/document-management/administrator/document-templates/add-new-category.png)


If Categories are used, users will see them as "folders" in the Document Wizard.

Questions: Document Templates
Document Management Administrator
Answer:
Management of Document Templates is handled here. The templates can be available for Omnia Document Management only or as general templates as well.


**Note!** This list and the list on the "Templates" tab under "Document profiles" are connected. Changes you make here for Controlled Documents templates are reflected in the list on the "Templates" tab and vice versa.


The list of available templates can look like this:


![](https://github.com/preciofishbone/OmniaDocs/raw/master/document-management/administrator/document-templates/document-templates-list.png)


+ **Language**: Select language for a list of templates in that language.
+ **(Symbol)**: This colummn indicates the file type.
+ **Template Name**: Name of the template.
+ **Scope**: In this column you can see if the template is applicable for Controlled Documents Only, or for general documents as well (in this case the field is empty).
+ **Document Profile**: States which Document Profile the template is connected to. You can go to the settings for the Document Profile by clicking the link.


To edit the settings for a template, or to delete it, use the icons:


![](https://github.com/preciofishbone/OmniaDocs/raw/master/document-management/administrator/document-templates/document-templates-list-icons.png)


**Tip!** When editing a template you can “update” by uploading another, updated file, but still use the same template name and other settings.

Questions: How do I setup a page footer?
Answer:
Page footers can be used to place and edit a footer on all pages in Omnia that uses a certain Master Page.

1. Select Feature.
2. Then select Master Page.


You can add content for three footer positions. Use the tabs do do that.


![](http://omnia-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_images/page-footer-tabs.png)


The three tabs work the same way. You of course don’t have to use all three positions. Using just the “Left” tab and instead using tab positions or a table, could also work.


Use “Widths” to set the width for each position (Left, Middle, Right). Set the width in pixels using the left field, or as a percentage, using the right field.


Use the content area to add text, images or links.


You can set Text color, Background color, Margin and Padding for the footer. Below these setting you can see a preview. The margin is space between the footer and the main part of the page. Padding is top and bottom spacing within the footer.


You can also use the preview at the bottom to see what the footer will like in different window widths, for example on mobile devices. Just “grab” the handle and slide to the width you wish to preview.

Questions: How do I use the Image Picker?
What is the Image Picker?
Answer:
When browsing for an image using Quick Edit (for publishing pages and news article pages), you use the Omnia Image Picker. Start by selecting an image library. Normally there are one or more central image banks available, and one local image library. The local library is most often called just “Images”.

You can’t upload images to a central image bank if you don’t have appropriate administrator permissions, but you can to the local image library. When you are allowed to upload images, an “Upload” button is shown.

Click the button to upload any image from your computer. After you have uploaded, you can insert the image on the page.

Use the top right field to search for images in the selected image bank or library.

![](http://omnia-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_images/imagepicker_search.png)

There can be some metadata fields (Properties) available for filtering. In this example, Image Type, Image Size and Image Category is available. Open the list or click the button (depending on type of field) and select filter.

Questions: What settings are available for My Links control?
Settings for the control
Answer:
The following settings are available: ![](http://omnia-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_images/my-links-block-settings-b.png) [**General**](http://omnia-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/my-workplace/my-links/index.html#general) On the General tab you can set the following:
  • __Title:__ Add the title to be displayed for the web part/block.
  • __Sorted by:__ Choose to sort the list alphabetically or in order by last visited.
  • __View Template:__ Select how to display the links, as a simple list or as app icons. (See below for some examples app icons.)
  • __Item Limit:__ The maximum number of items to display before a “Show more” link appears.
[**Custom Colors**](http://omnia-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/my-workplace/my-links/index.html#custom-colors) You should primarily set colors through Theme colors in Omnia Admin (System/Settings/Default colors). If you still would like custom colors for the control, you can set them using this tab.

Questions: Can you add My links to a legacy page?
My Links Web Part and block
Answer:
My links can also be added to any legacy page as a web part and to any Quick Page as a block. Mandatory links, links the user have selected and personal links will be displayed. The links list can not be altered through the web part/block. The my links web part/block settings are web part scoped.


Here’s an example where My Links is used as a block:

![](http://omnia-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_images/my-links-block.png)

Questions: My Links Mobile Navigation
Answer: The My links control will not be shown when the screen is below a certain width. When the my links control is hidden, the mobile navigation will be shown. The mobile navigation includes the list of my links, but the user cannot add/remove links from the list.

Questions: How do you add personal Links?
Answer:
You can add a personal link by clicking the option “ADD PERSONAL LINK” and using he following settings: ![](http://omnia-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_images/create-link.png)
  • __Title:__ The title for the link, shown in the list.
  • __Url__: The link url.
  • __Category:__ Links that share the same category will be grouped together when “Show categories” is selected.
  • __Information:__ It is optional to add information about the link. If added, an i-icon will be shown.
  • __Open in New Window:__ Defines whether to open the link in a new window or not.
  • __Icon:__ The user can select from built-in icons based on Font Awesome or any image uploaded to a document library in SharePoint.
  • __Icon background color:__ The background color for the icon here. If not setm the default icon background color will be used.

Questions: My links
Answer:
The My Links control makes it possible for the logged on user to have quick access to resources that are often used. The control will display links that are mandatory, links that the user have selected from the Common Links list, and personal links the user has created.

For more information see: http://omnia-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/my-workplace/my-links/index.html#my-links

Questions: Changing notification panel colors?
Answer: You should primarily set colors through Theme colors in Omnia Admin (System/Settings/Default colors). If you still would like custom colors for the control, you can set them using this tab.

Questions: How do I change to layout of the notification panel tabs?
Answer:
In the layout section in the notification panel settings you can set the layout of the panel tabs.


+ **Responsive**: On small screens the tabs will be shown horizontally, on larger screens it will be shown vertically.
+ **Horizontal**: The tabs will always be shown horizontally.
+ **Vertical**: The tabs will always be shown vertically.
**Note!** Additional design can be applied using a customer specific CSS extension.

Questions: How do I delete a notification panel category?
Answer:
Follow these steps to delete a category:


1. Hover any of the existing categories on the left-hand side in the notification panel settings.
2. Click on the remove icon.
3. Click "Save".

Questions: How do you edit a notification panel category?
Answer:
Follow these steps to edit a category:


1. Click on any of the existing categories on the left-hand side in the notification panel settings.
2. Change title, icon or view controls etc.\n3. Click "Save".

Questions: How do I add a notification to the notification panel?
Adding a category to the notification panel?
Answer:
If you would like to add a notification, you use Add Category in the notification panel settings. Follow these steps:


1. Click "Add Category" on the left-hand side.
2. Add a category title and select an icon from the Font Awesome library.
3. Add one or more available view controls (installed in Omnia) from the list.
4. You can sort the rendering order of the view controls using drag and drop. 
5. Select notification type: Automatic or Custom. Automatic can be used on all Omnia view controls. This means that the notification count on the category will be calculated based on the result in the view. A custom notification service can be used for legacy web parts or view controls that require specific business logic. Note! If "Custom" is selected, a notification service url needs to be provided (Example: User feed notification url: https://pfp-tc1.azurewebsites.net/api/social/following/new?dayLimit=30)

Questions: What is the notification panel used for?
Answer: The notification panel is a concept in Omnia Intranet mainly used on the start page. The purpose is to help the end user to find out what information has been updated within different areas of the portal. There are a number of settings for the visual appearance.

Questions: How can I customize the user feed?
What user feed settings are there?
How do I change the colors of the user feed?
Can I change the height of the user feed?
Answer:
The available user feed settings are:


+ **Title**: You can edit the title displayed for the list.
+ **Default height**: Set the default height in pixels. When there is more to display in the list, a "Show more" button is shown.
+ **Custom colors**: You should primarily set colors through Theme colors in Omnia Admin (System/Settings/Default colors). If you still would like custom colors for the control, you can set them using this tab.
